synopsis: In episode #12 of PBR, hosts Devam and Ahir welcome the talented musician Valante, who shares his unique journey through childhood challenges, creativity, and the importance of embracing life's uncertainties. The conversation flows from personal stories of resilience to the beauty of music as a means of expression, leaving listeners inspired to appreciate the art of simply existing.
quotes: Life needs to happen for a while in order for me to have something to express.
Every child is dependent on their parents, but I always felt very safe and taken care of by all older people around me.
It's difficult to not project your idea of what you want someone to be onto them.
If you want to make the world a better place, take a look at yourself and make a change.
You can really change the world in small ways.
Just because you're not giving up all of your possessions doesn't mean you're not helping.
I always catch myself spiraling in my thoughts and becoming afraid, even though she's really doing everything she can to make me feel safe.
I think a lot about my students and I try to give them a sense of peace if I can, but I also think that they're too young to really take it aboard.
This is the perfect music to exist to.
